title: Workshop on Applying the ASSURE Model for Technology-Integrated Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Device Proficiency and Understanding of Secondary Education Curricula
context.additional_context: Focuses on designing technology-integrated lessons using the ASSURE model for middle/high school educational administrators/leaders aged 40+, conducted in classrooms equipped with digital devices (tablets, interactive whiteboards, etc.).

learning_goals: Learners can concretize technology-integrated lesson designs by applying the six stages of the ASSURE model: learner analysis, goal setting, strategy/material selection, utilization, learner engagement facilitation, and evaluation
Learners can propose at least three instructional strategies that promote learner engagement using digital tools (quiz platforms, collaboration software, etc.)
Learners can explain methods for measuring instructional effectiveness by designing formative assessment tools (real-time feedback systems, observation checklists, etc.)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
